intro: Silene kiwuensis, commonly known as the Congo catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or wetlands. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often prostrate or ascending. Silene kiwuensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
